trans-unit.source: Implements different <xref uid="langword_csharp_XPath" name="XPath" href=""></xref> and <xref uid="langword_csharp_XSLT" name="XSLT" href=""></xref> functions.
Checks that the extension and script namespaces do not clash.
The namespace URI.
An integer used for internal infrastructure only.
Evaluates the argument to a string that is an XML qualified name.
This method implements the `element-available` function specified by [W3C XSL Transformations (XSLT)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=49919).
The qualified name is expanded into an `expanded name` by using the namespace declarations in scope for the expression.
The ElementAvailable function returns `true` if and only if the `expanded name` is the name of an instruction.
The XML qualified name.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the [expanded name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=148269) is the name of an instruction.
If the <xref uid="langword_csharp_expanded name" name="expanded name" href=""></xref> has a namespace URI equal to the XSLT namespace URI, then it refers to an element defined by XSLT.
Otherwise, the expanded-name refers to an extension element.

If the <xref uid="langword_csharp_expanded name" name="expanded name" href=""></xref> has a null namespace URI, the element-available function will return <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines equality between collections of type <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem"></xref>.
<xref:System.Double> that specifies the operation to be performed
<xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem"></xref>.
<xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem"></xref>.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the collections are equal, otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Formats an exception message composed of a format string supplied by the res parameter and arguments contained by the args parameter.
A string that contains the message resource.
A list of strings that represent arguments to the method.
A string that contains the formatted exception message.
Implements the format-number() XSLT function.
For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.
The FormatNumberDynamic method formats `value` by using the `formatPicture` and decimal-format [expanded name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=148269).
The `errorMessageName` is used only for error reporting and must contain the qualified name of the decimal-format object.
<xref:System.Double> that contains the value to format.
String that contains the format picture.
<xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> that contains the format name.
String that contains the error message name.
Returns a string that indicates the number format.
For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.
Implements the format-number() XSLT function.
For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.
The FormatNumberStatic method formats the given value by using the given decimal formatter object, created by <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XsltLibrary.RegisterDecimalFormatter%2A>.
<xref:System.Double> that contains value to format.
<xref:System.Double> that contains the formatter index.
A string that indicates the format.
For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.
Implements the [function-available()](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144249) XSLT function.
<xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> name object.
A Boolean value that is if the function identified by name is available.
Determines whether two nodes have the same node type and, if nodes of that node type have expanded-names, the same expanded names.
<xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref> object to compare.
<xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref> object to compare.
A Boolean value that is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if two nodes have the same node type and, if nodes of that node type have expanded names, the same expanded names.
Converts the language identifier (as specified in the <xref uid="langword_csharp_xml:lang" name="xml:lang" href=""></xref> attribute) to the culture identifier (LCID).
String that indicates language.
Boolean value that is true if language is forward compatible.
A string that contains the culture identifier.
Gets a string that indicates the number format.
<xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of strings that represent arguments to the method.
<xref:System.Double> that indicates the format string.
<xref:System.Double> that indicates the language.
String that contains the letter value.
String that contains the grouping separator.
<xref:System.Double> that contains the grouping size.
A string that indicates the number format.
Used for internal infrastructure only.
Registers a decimal-format with the given expanded name.
For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.
<xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> object that contains name.
String containing infinity symbol.
String containing NaN symbol.
String containing characters to format.
In the current implementation the return value is always 0.
Registers a decimal formatter object and returns a unique index assigned to it.
The decimal formatter object is used by the format-number() XSLT function.
For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.
String that contains the format picture.
String that contains the infinity symbol.
String that contains the NaN symbol.
String that contains characters to format.
Returns a unique index of type <xref:System.Double> assigned to a decimal formatter object.
Evaluates whether the left expression is greater than or equal to, or less than or equal to, the right expression based on the opCode passed.
Specifies how to perform the evaluation of two expressions: If opCode is equal to 2, evaluates the XPath expression "left < right".
If opCode is equal to 3, evaluates the XPath expression "left <= right".
If opCode is equal to 4, evaluates the XPath expression "left > right".
If opCode is equal to 5, evaluates the XPath expression "left >= right"
Expression to evaluate.
Expression to evaluate.
A Boolean value that is true if the left expression is greater than or equal to the right expression.
